title: fatty acid analysis sponges
article_citation: Kluijver Ad, Nierop KGJ, Morganti TM, Bart MC, Slaby BM, Hanz U, Goeij JMd, Mienis F, Middelburg JJ (2021) Bacterial precursors and unsaturated long-chain fatty acids are biomarkers of North-Atlantic deep-sea demosponges. PLoS ONE 16(1): e0241095. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0241095

source.description:
Add
Blight and Dyer mix, close with lid and shake/vortex

Weight 30-50 mg dried sponge sample in extraction tubes (Kimax®centrifuge tube).
This amount is enough to do either lipid-class or total lipid analysis, if you want to do both, weight a double amount.
Extract the sample in an ultrasonic bath for

add
DCM, close lid and shake/vortex

Extract for minimal
on a roller table - horizontal shaker. Check that lids are tightly closed!

Prepare P-buffer: dissolve
K2HPO4 in
mQ in a 1 L glass bottle, adust to pH 7-9 with
HCl, check with pH paper

Prepare standards:
C19:0 FAME in
hexane (100 x stock)
C12:0 FAME in
hexane (100 x stock)

Prepare
methanolic NaOH by dissolving
CH3NaO in
MeOH

Prepare Bligh and Dyer extraction (BDE) mix: methanol (MeOH)/ dichloromethane (DCM) / P-buffer in ratio of 2/1/0.8 (v/v/v), e.g.
MeOH,
DCM and
P-buffer in a 500 mL Erlenmeyer with glass stopper

add
P-buffer, close lid and shake/vortex

Let layers separate by either leaving the tubes overnight in the freezer of by gentle centrifugation
(room temperature)

Collect the DCM layer (bottom) with a Pasteur pipette or a glass syringe into 50 mL glass vials. The type of vials depend on the evaporator. Take a bit of air into the syringe or pipette. Bring the tip carefully in the bottom layer. Let a few air bubbles out to clean the tip of the syringe/pipette. Collect the DCM and avoid taking the fluffy layer.
When using a glass syring, clean it in DCM: methanol (1:1) between samples.

Add again
DCM, let layers separate (centrifugation or freezer) and collect DCM layer into the same vial

Dry samples completely under a gentle N2-stream in a turbovap (
, maximum 5 psi pressure, but start with 1-2 psi)

Transfer sample in
(approximately) DCM:MeOH (1:1) to a pre-weighed 4 ml vial and dry in a Flexivap
under a gentle N2 stream
Weigh your vials to obtain total lipid weight /sponge dry weight. Now you have your Bligh and Dyer extract (BDE)
Optional: if your sample contains some residue, it can be cleaned over a pasteur glass pipette with pre-extracted cotton wool in DCM: MeOH (1:1)

Prepare columns: add a ball of pre-extracted cotton-wool into the tip of a 10 mLglass pipette. Add 1 spoon (~0.5 g) on top. The whole column is ~3 fingers width, 3 cm. The column is stored into a cylinder filled with DCM. Make sure the silica layer is soaked in DCM. Gently tap the column to get rid of air bubbles.

Activate silicic acid gel by heating it at
, for at least 2 hours and allow it to cool. Once activated, it can be kept in a closed bottle for 2 or 3 days.

Prepare
acetic acid: add
glacial acetic acid (
) into
miliQ and fill to
in a 100 mL vollumetric flask.
Put the column in a holder, place a vial or beaker glass underneath and wash the column with DCM

Dissolve and add your sample in
DCM.

Don't disturb the coyour neutral lipid fraction. Collect in a 10 mL vial if you want to analyze it or in a waste beaker/vial if it can be discarded.
Don't disturb the column!

Elute with
acetone (picograde pestinorm), this is your glycolipid fraction. Collect in a 10 mL vial if you want to analyze it or in a waste beaker/vial if it can be discarded.

Elute with
MeOH into a 20 m glass vial , this is your phospholipid fraction that will be used for further analysis.

Dry the MeOH fraction in the turbovap (
max 5 psi, but start with 1-2 psi)

Add to dried sample 1 ml MeOH/toluene (1:1 v/v)
Add 1 ml 0.2 M methanolic NaOH (exactly with glass syringe/pipette)
Add
C19:0 FAME standard

Incubate at
in a oven

Stop methylation by adding
hexane
acetic acid (exactly, with pipette)
milliQ
Mix very well by shaking or vortexing. Let layers separate. The upper (hexane) layer should be clear
Collect the upper layer with a Pasteur pipette into a 10 ml glass vial. Avoid taking the water layer.

Add again
hexane, repeat 31-32, collect in the same vial

Add again
hexane, repeat 31-32, collect in the same vial
Evaporate hexane until complete dryness

cases.title: acid methylation, alternative to base methylation
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3svv","text":"Add 0.5 mL DCM:MeOH (1:1) to dry sample vials","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k4qm","text":"Transfer the samples into a 4 ml glass vial","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fp7al","text":"N2 dry samples ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":1,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb08m","text":"Add 0.5 mL BF3-methanol  (Merck Millipore: product code 801663, 20%)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":13,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57sbk","text":"Incubate samples at 60°C for 10 minutes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o415","text":"Add 0.5 mL MilliQ water and 40 µl standard C19:0 FAME","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":44,"length":4,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1gkqs","text":"Add 1 mL DCM ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck0sh","text":"Collect the DCM layer (bottom layer) into another 4 mL glass vial","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daius","text":"Repeat the wash procedure 2 more times","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a7db","text":"Dry under N2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":11,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.description:
Add
C12:0 FAME and ~
hexane or ethyl acetate Transfer samples into GC analysis vials.
Store in
freezer until analysis
Hexane and ethyl acetate give comparable results. Make sure that C12:0 FAME is in the same solvent

cases.title: additional analysis: DMDS
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6p4k","text":"DMDS derivatization on FAME samples to determine position of double bonds with GC-MS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60oso","text":"Transfer an aliquot (~1/3 of GC sample) for DMDS derivatization into a 4 mL glass vial (with screw cap) and dry under N2.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":119,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fo4gp","text":"Prepare a 60 mg/mL iodine (I2) solution in (di-ethyl)ether, e.g. weigh 100 mg I2 (Sigma-Aldrich) in 166 mL (di-ethyl)ether (Fluka) and dissolve ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":28,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":79,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"benve","text":"Prepare a 5% Na2S2O3solution, e.g. weigh 100 mg Na2S2O3 (Sigma Aldrich) in a 4 mL glass vial with screw cap, add 2 mL milliQ and dissolve. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":17,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":19,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":50,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":52,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":54,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lltc","text":"Add 50 µl hexane, 50 µL DMDS (Sigma Aldrich) and 10 µL I2 solution","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":56,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2irvn","text":"Incubate overnight at 40 °C.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r1hu","text":"Cool down. Add 200 µL hexane and 100 µL Na2S2O3solution","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":42,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":44,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":46,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m9o0","text":"Mix the sample vigorously and let layers separate at RT. The upper layer should be clear","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5r57","text":"Collect the hexane (upper) layer with a Pasteur pipette into a clean 4 ml glass vial, avoid taking the water layer. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lb8h","text":"Add again 200 µl hexane and repeat step 7-8 into the same vial. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h05e","text":"Add again 200 µl hexane and repeat step 7-8 into the same vial. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lq7l","text":"Dry sample under N2 until a small amount of solvent is left in the vial","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edpi7","text":"Water traces are removed over a Na2SO4 column. Prepare a small column (in Pasteur pipette), add a small ball of clean cotton wool with a tweezer and add ~2 cm Na2SO4 by scooping up. Wash column with DCM: MeOH (9:1).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":34,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":37,"length":2,"style":"sub"},{"offset":161,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":164,"length":2,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1334l","text":"Add sample with Pasteur pipette.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8gf8","text":"Elute with ~ 2 mL DCM :MeOH (9:1) into a clean vial.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i1r9","text":"Dry sample under N2.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4t6bb","text":"Transfer sample in ~50 µl hexane or ethyl acetate to a GC analysis vial","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: additional analysis : hydrogenation
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmpps","text":"hydrogenation on FAME samples to remove double bonds, to facilitatie determination of branching in sponge FAME on GC-MS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rqbt","text":"Transfer an aliquot (~1/3 of GC sample) for hydrogenation into a 4 ml glass vial (with screw cap) and dry under N2. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":113,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kp39","text":"Clean stirring bars (one per sample) by rinsing them 3 times in a beaker or vial with milliQ, then DCM and finally MeOH. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efaht","text":"Dissolve sample by adding 3 mL ethyl acetate to vial","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu2c2","text":"Add a spatula (10-30 mg) platinum oxide (PtO2) (Sigma Aldrich)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":44,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7sds6","text":"Add 1 drop of glacial acetic acid","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uulr","text":"Bubble with hydrogen gas for a couple of hours","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"408q4","text":"Close the vial and stir over night at room temperature","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vgbu","text":"Prepare a small column (in Pasteur pipette), add a ball of clean cotton wool with tweezers and add 2 cm of MgSO4 (bottom) and 2 cm of Na2CO3 (top) by scooping up. Wash the column with DCM","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":111,"length":2,"style":"sub"},{"offset":136,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":139,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aigk","text":"Add sample to the column","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhukj","text":"Elute in a clean 4 mL glass vial with ~ 3 mL DCM","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pbnr","text":"Dry sample under N2 and transfer in 50 µl ethyl acetate for GC analysis. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: additional analysis: alox column
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckgnm","text":"In case you need to separate alcohol and FAMEs from a methylated total lipid sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sgpj","text":"1. Prepare a Pasteur pipette with pre-extracted cotton wool and 4 cm activated Alox (EcoChrom). Alox is activated in 2 h at 150°C and transfer it immediately to a desiccator for storage (min. 1 h, max. 1 day; no drying agent). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvnq4","text":"2. Rinse the column with 9:1 hexane:DCM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29fhn","text":"3. Add your sample (max 5 mg) into very small amounts of the first eluens onto the column","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3to89","text":"4. Elute with ~4 mL 9:1 hexane:DCM into a 4 ml vial, this is the apolar fraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crb1d","text":"5. Elute with ~3 mL DCM in a 4 ml vial, this is the FAME fraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jgpd","text":"6. Elute with ~3 mL 1:1 DCM:methanol into a 4 mL vial, this is the polar alcohol fraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s69j","text":"7. Dry the fractions of interest under N2 and transfer to GC-vials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.description:
Add 1 ml
of DCM and evaporate again.

description: This protocol has been used to analyse fatty acid composition of sponges (Porifera). The original protocol has been developed at NIOZ Yerseke, former NIOO-CEME (Netherlands) (Boschker and Middelburg) and has been used to quantify PLFA in combination with stable isotopes for sediments, plankton, organisms (including sponges). This protocol has been adopted to the procedures of the organic geochemistry lab at Utrecht University.
